meanings.definition: The opening words of a text, especially when used as a title.
meanings.sent1: The incipit of the book immediately caught my attention.
meanings.sent2: The incipit of the story set the tone for the entire novel.
meanings.sent3: The incipit of the play was so intriguing that I couldn't wait to read more.
meanings.sent4: Her incipit was like a key that unlocked the mysteries of the narrative.
meanings.sent5: The incipit was like a bright beacon guiding readers into the world of the novel.

meanings.definition: The beginning or introductory part of a musical composition.
meanings.sent1: The incipit of the symphony was grand and majestic.
meanings.sent2: The incipit of the song immediately captured the audience's attention.
meanings.sent3: The incipit of the concert was so lively that it made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent4: His incipit on the piano was like a gentle breeze on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent5: The incipit of the opera was so powerful that it echoed in the hearts of the listeners.
